metadata.title: Week 2 Day 4: Introduction to Latin Verbs
metadata.faith_phrase: Laborare est orare (To work is to pray)

prior_knowledge_digest: Students should be familiar with basic Latin nouns and their declensions, as well as the concept of subject-verb agreement in English. They have been introduced to the first declension and some common vocabulary. Understanding of noun cases and their functions in sentences is essential. Students should also recall the importance of Latin roots in English derivatives.
yesterday_recap: Yesterday, we explored the first declension nouns in more depth and practiced forming simple sentences using these nouns.

lesson_flow.description: Review first declension nouns and their endings.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students will recite noun endings and provide examples.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Ensure students can differentiate between nominative and accusative cases.

lesson_flow.description: Quick quiz on vocabulary from previous lessons.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students will write down translations for given Latin words.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the concept of Latin verbs and basic conjugation.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and take notes on verb conjugation patterns.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Highlight similarities and differences with English verbs.

lesson_flow.description: Practice conjugating simple verbs in the present tense.
lesson_flow.student_action: Conjugate verbs with guidance and feedback.

lesson_flow.description: Short written exercise on verb conjugations.
lesson_flow.student_action: Complete a worksheet with verb conjugation tasks.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Assess understanding and provide immediate feedback.

lesson_flow.description: Summarize key points and answer any remaining questions.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to reflect on their learning.

behavior.loop_behavior: Repeat instructions with variations if needed
